value.title: 3 ways to REDUCE DATA In Power BI Desktop (No Premium needed!)
value.excerpt: Sometimes you want to reduce data in Power BI Desktop so it's easier to work with. Then work with all the data in the Power BI Service. Patrick shows you 3 ways that can help do this without using Incremental Refresh or needing Power BI Premium!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Avoid the full refresh with Incremental Refresh in Power BI (Premium)
value.excerpt: Is the full refresh of Incremental Refresh taking a long time? Or, even timing out? Patrick shows you how you can avoid the full refresh and refresh each partition individually when using Power BI Premium!  Handling deletes within Incremental Refresh in Power BI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nKVrl0ec6uE

value.title: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server
value.excerpt: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server  In this video, I walk through the steps to create your Power BI Report in order to publish it to Power BI Report Server. This involves downloading and installing Power BI Desktop optimized for Power BI Report Server and connecting to Analysis Services

value.title: Debugging a slow Power BI report with Phil Seamark
value.excerpt: Phil sits down with us to walk through his process in debugging a slow Power BI report. This uses some new features in Power BI Desktop as well as using DAX Studio to get further insights.  Connect with Phil Twitter: https://twitter.com/PhilSeamark Blog: https://dax.tips/   Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7

He walks through Power BI Desktop to show how he fixed his Row-Level Security problem.  LET'S

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)
